item.title: Rubbish dumped outside 27 and 28 Cato St, 8th November
item.description:
These two Air B&Bs 27 and 28 Cato St have, as they do every single weekend, dumped rubbish on the street when there is no scheduled collection until Tuesday. This has already been ripped open by pests - pigeons, seagulls, foxes, who knows - so waste is now spilling onto the pavement. There is also a scattering of loose rubbish blowing around up and down the whole street, and under the garages.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28-33, Cato Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dropped curb out of use, 8th November
item.description:
There is a dropped curb which was used by a house which used to occupy this land. Years ago this was taken down and two new builds built on the same piece of land, neither has a driveway. Cars are now regularly being ticketed, this is a new issue as cars were never ticketed before. The pavement needs to be raised back as it's not right that people are being fined over an old dropped pavement that is no longer in use. Oh and by the way, the parking officer parked illegally on the corner on double yellow lines while he called a friend, had a long chat and then proceeded to ticket the car.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salisbury Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 50 Well Walk, 8th November
item.description:
We have had our drive totally blocked by Line Bikes ans have no access in or out. This is not totally unacceptable. I have reported multiple tines that the situation is getting worse. This parking bay for bikes is causing chaos, is dangerous and my 87 year old disabled mother is unable to visit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Well Walk, Belsize Park, London
